Reviews.Title: Toshiba TouchScreen Laptop - Worth looking at.
Reviews.Author: What the HEY ! "What the HEY !!"
Reviews.Content: Just received this laptop a few days ago so I've only used it for about 10 hrs so far.Overall, I am happy with this laptop.  Fast enough for normal uses, well laid out, good resolution screen.  It is a 'touch screen', but a 'soft' LCD screen, NOT the glass screen type.  With keyboard, mouse and touch screen,  it is pretty flexible efficiency-wise.Good size 500 Gig hard drive, and the 4 Gig of ram is adequate.  Expandable to 16Gig, and the PDF Manual even shows you how to add memory.Toshiba keyboard functions are well thought-out.  Nice.This laptop is worth a look.  If you are an average user this computer has everything you will need, and it boots up quicker than the average laptop.

Reviews.Title: This laptop has everything it's awesome
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this Toshiba touchscreen laptop.. it does just about anything has just enough memory and ram and is very fast. love the touchscreen and everything it's just a great pc for the price and I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: great laptop
Reviews.Author: flexx
Reviews.Content: great hdd space. a little heavy but other than that I love it. has an awesome screen and it doesn't get hot like other laptops i've had

Reviews.Title: great laptop
Reviews.Author: Erich Schmunk
Reviews.Content: love the flex in the keyboard and the soft touch screen.  not sold on windows 8 though.  loved the price also

Reviews.Title: Toshiba
Reviews.Author: Lioness "lioness2001"
Reviews.Content: Toshiba makes great computers.  I had one for almost 7 years and the monitor (laptop) starting having problems. I wanted a Mac but couldn't afford it. So I replaced it with this one. Admittedly Windows 8 has a small learning curve, but it's a great little computer and easy to start up and get going.  Fits all my needs. I'm computer savvy and I would say this is a nice computer for students and folks who don't want to spend $$$ on  a Mac.I wish it had Bluetooth and a better speaker but those are minor things. If you want those, spend more money and get it.

Reviews.Title: good computer for a college student
Reviews.Author: Miranda
Reviews.Content: I aboslutely love this computer...it does all the essentials for a college student.... love tht its touch screen...only bad problem is the screen DOES get dirty after using it for a while...i just touch it up with cleaner and its good as new...gives good battery life and the computer its self...i have had it for about 4 months now and had no problems with it then my last computer...

Reviews.Title: Will not back there product
Reviews.Author: Fall
Reviews.Content: I will never buy a Toshiba again! I bought a Toshiba touch screen laptop and within a week the screen started to crack. I called Toshiba customer service cause you have a 1 year warranty. I called and they said we wont cover any damages to screens. I told them touch screen is a feature and they should back there product. They did not care. I have to wait a year till my in store warranty can kick in.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: cbroberts2010
Reviews.Content: Please do not let the reviews deter you from checking this out.  I think laptops are getting a bad rap because of Windows 8...I have really enjoyed since I just took a little time to get to know it.  This Toshiba is very good for the money...what do people expect for under $500.00

Reviews.Title: Sound half star.
Reviews.Author: A. Scarlatos
Reviews.Content: The laptop is great and I think I like windows 8. Not sure if it was factory new as it came in a taped up box and the laptop itself was wrapped in shrink wrap with the use of a hot air gun. And the only thing that came in the box was the power supply and the laptop.The sound is terrible even with headphones, I should give Toshiba less stars for sound but everything else is perfect. The screen does seem to be plastic.

Reviews.Title: met all my expectations for a nice computer
Reviews.Author: Chantel Hughes
Reviews.Content: Amazing performance, perfect in every way! Really liked how accurate the touchscreen was.Very professional and has a good battery life

Reviews.Title: Pure Junk
Reviews.Author: Disenchanted
Reviews.Content: Toshiba low-end laptops are pure garbage. Flimsy, cheap, unreliable, and built with the cheapest components available. Save your money and spend a bit more on something else not built by Toshiba. Best case scenario, you might get 6-12 months out of your laptop before things start to fail. Worse case scenario (as I've just experienced), your laptop will last a matter of weeks before the lights go out. And unfortunately for the buyer, Toshiba often refuses to meet their own warranty obligations. Considering how cheap the laptops are, they don't want to help you, or fix the laptop. They would lose money otherwise. So if you send it in for repairs, like they'll inevitably recommend, you'll find yourself being asked to pay elaborate sums of money because the 'scope of work' is not within the boundaries of the original warranty agreement. This of course is not true. Toshiba is simply trying to force the added costs of warranty repairs down the throats of uninformed customers. Their laptops are cheap, but they won't actually save you any money in the long run.Save your money. Don't buy Toshiba. Consider any laptops made by Toshiba as being purely disposable, or built for third word countries with no consumer protection laws.

Reviews.Title: I Love this Laptop
Reviews.Author: chris and sherry
Reviews.Content: I bought mine in December 2013. I also bought a 3 year warranty to top the toshiba manufacture warranty that came with it, so I am covered for 4 years. I have not had a problem with this laptop. It works perfect at all times. I did buy a toshiba 2 TB external drive for back-ups. I had some problems getting used to Windows 8.1, I called toshiba, he spent over an hour walking me through everything, and gave me time to take notes, (I am used to windows 7). After almost 6 months, still no issues with the touchscreen or anything. I use this for online college, selling online, I have ADD and usually have 8 to 10 tabs opened at once, and unless I have internet issues from my phone company, I never have a problem. My teenage daughters go on their sites with this, and it comes with a free windows security scan. I loved the support that I got from toshiba, and this laptop. I carry it all over, and it does get bangged up through my laptop bag (This is why I have a long warranty plan). I take pictures of everything, up to 300 pictures a week, they look so amazing and more detailed on this laptop. I have gotten addicted to the touch screen to manage my pictures as well, it makes the task so much quicker!! Another bonus, I can copy DVD's without any other programs, Windows 8.1 is set up to do it easier. Overall, it took me a few weeks to get used to windows 8.1 and I kept going back to my HP with fingerprint reader, but, now I only use this, and love it. It takes some time to adjust when upgrading, do not judge it until you have used it for at least 1 month. It starts up quickly every time and is connected to your FREE microsoft account for start up. Also, you can choose to keep a credit card on file through your microsoft account and buy apps that are not free, or there is an app to go straight to the toshiba store already programmed for you. Not only can you get updates from Microsoft for free, but Toshiba as well. The only thing I do not like is, I miss my fingerprint reader and have to remember my password (bad memory). This is a great buy and worth the money. If you have the option to get insurance, do so, touchscreens do break down more often.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: Mayco
Reviews.Content: I've only had this laptop for a few weeks but so far it's been great. Having a hard time getting used to Windows 8 but that's not Toshiba's fault. The real test will be in a couple of weeks when I do my taxes.

Reviews.Title: Very nice laptop
Reviews.Author: Carrie Eddy
Reviews.Content: Very nice laptop, fast, efficient, and also love the touch screen. had to get used to windows 8 though. would highly recommend to other people

Reviews.Title: A very good computer.
Reviews.Author: Brian A.
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with this purchase. Touch is a better user experience than using a mouse. The computer may take a little longer to load and play movies via DVD, but once loaded it plays the DVD without any problems. Four of my friends have purchased this exact model and all are pleased. Even more of my friends are interested.

Reviews.Title: Still Deciding
Reviews.Author: Bernie Berger
Reviews.Content: I just bought this from Amazon and received it yesterday.  It is a brand new unit and the battery does not fully charge.  It is only charging to 77%.  I did a troubleshooting and followed all the suggestions on fixing this and nothing fixed this.  I called Toshiba directly and they are sending me a battery for "free" with a $140.00 hold on my debit card for 30 days to ensure that I send the defective battery back to them.  I am not happy with this, but the only reason I am trying a new battery is because Amazon is so good on their word and customer service if I need to send this back.  So, the verdict for me on this laptop is still out.  IF, the battery fixes this problem, I will probably change my rating and revise my review.  However, if the battery problem continues after this, I will be returning the laptop to Amazon.  I have to give big kudos to Amazon for customer service.  I had 2 Amazon packages stolen from the building I live in, and Amazon gave me every penny back via an Amazon gift card within 24 hours.  I will continue being an Amazon customer because of this.  As of right now, I am barely satisfied with Toshiba customer service and hoping this improves if I keep this product.

Reviews.Title: Refurbished machines sent as NEW
Reviews.Author: RPlanet "Rich"
Reviews.Content: We received at least one machine that seems refurbished rather than new and it was also DOA (keyboard didn't work).

Reviews.Title: stupid design squared
Reviews.Author: Nick Halbrook
Reviews.Content: Firstly, bought this from Best Buy as they had it for ca$40 less than Amazon. In this get it now world in which Amazon performance is iconic Best Buy took nearly a week to get this to me and I am in a major metro area. Big box vs no box as they never processed this Saturday order until Monday and did not ship until Tuesday. Oddly, this price only available from them on line making my trip to their store pointless. Screwed up bidniz model IMVVHO.Touch screen design is absurd. Must gingerly reach across expansive keyboard to get to screen and in doing so you had durst not touch the keyboard! Max angle of screen tilt is only ca135 degrees making it difficult to view and use keyboard at same time up close if you hold it while in a recliner. Screen is very very touch sensitive. Huge keyboard which is nice. An odd nearly 2:1 aspect ratio on screen which reduces its at first gloss largeness utility as headers and footers eat up too much vertical space. A myopic gamer benefit? Puter has a zillion bloatware items - must have hired the same people for doing this as Verizon! Edges of open case are hard and sharp w/virtually no radius so not comfy to rest hand upon. All in all a rather paradoxical do not touch me design! Screen has a very small view angle before things become obscured by color change even on high contrast.As far as Win 8.1 goes, so far so good. Seems just like another of their new OSs with change for the sake of change and fixes for things not broken - a MS if not  a big bidniz penchant. Desktop icon text shadow cannot be turned off as the selector box to turn it off does not work so only way to get non-fuzzy view of text is to use a black desktop. Apparently there has been a devolution in the intellectual capital that used to exist in there being an amazingly effective auto select genetic like ability for the OS to choose color contrasts between text and background as well as between adjacent backgrounds. Color wheel stupidity now seems to rule. Hmmm - did accidentally find a way to effectively deal with the text shadow and have my yellow desktop but damned if I can figure it out again. Something to do with larger font / bold font as I recall.This monster is beyond heavy! Definitely a home machine only unless you are a Charles Atlas. Battery life ... what battery life ??? Again a home only machine. Trial only versions of office and security suite software. Put Avast on last week. OK.

Reviews.Title: Touch screen broke after 3 months
Reviews.Author: David Phillips
Reviews.Content: A very low quality laptop. I've had so many problems with this computer I can't even begin to discuss them all. The main issue right now is that the touch screen doesn't respond to touch anymore, which makes Windows 8 the biggest nightmare in the world to navigate. The sound controls sometimes work, sometimes they don't. Sometimes the touch pad works, sometimes it doesn't. Sometimes the size of the screen expands to 200% and won't go back until I restart the computer. I've had to wipe clean the computer twice to get it to function correctly, as correct as possible without a touch screen that is. Screws unscrew themselves on the bottom of the laptop and fall out occasionally. Please save yourself a headache and spend an extra $100-200 dollars on a better quality, non-Toshiba product. I wish i had.

Reviews.Title: where is it?
Reviews.Author: Sharon M.
Reviews.Content: Great value for the price  I can not comment on the computers performance yet because it will not be shipped for a month.the interesting thing is amazon charge the credit card a month in advance? must be having cash flow issues.

Reviews.Title: Usable but disappointing
Reviews.Author: Bobby Butler
Reviews.Content: I am not tech savvy so I can't evaluate this computer in terms of hard drive, GB etc.  I order lots of stuff from Amazon, read email and visit a few web sites.  That's it.Many times web sites won't load at all or is very slow to load.  Often when I have problems loading a web site I go to my son's desk top and can load the same site with no problem.Almost always watching videos is very frustrating.  They start, stop, restart (I guess that's called buffering).  Again, I can go to my son's desk top and have no problem.The repair shop we use suggested I take it to different locations with wifi and see if I have the same problems.  It's the same everywhere I've used it.I live in a rural area and many AM radio stations are not available.  I live in a 2000 sq ft house but If I am at the opposite end of the house I lose the signal about half the time.  It's very frustrating.The touchscreen seems to go spastic sometimes.  I touch the screen and it expands so much it is unusable, and when I try to reduce the size it goes into crazy gyrations.  I realize this isn't exactly technical language, but it's the only way I can explain it.Sometimes the computer works perfectly, but most often it is very frustrating and disappointing.I would appreciate any suggestions.

Reviews.Title: Not bashing the computer itself, but the company purchased from!
Reviews.Author: TABITHA MONTGOMERY
Reviews.Content: DO NOT Order from Ocean Reef Electronics....this has got to be one of the worst companies when it come to customer service or lack there of....I bought this tablet through Amazon shipped to me from this company, the first day I got it and plugged it up straight out of the box the computer said plugged in battery not charging...I left plugged overnight and when I got up the next morning the battery had 0% charge on it???I ht e followed a few steps that I googled to try to get it to charge didn't work... First contacted the company got an answering machine and told to go to Amazon to send a message, did that... Waited the following day called company again during regular business hours again got a message to go to Amazon...I left a message this time and went back to Amazon...they finally sent me a email instructing me on how to return the item, but the thing is they make you pay for sending it back to them when it's their fault you got a faulty item anyway...and on top of that they don't try to resolve the issue with replacement (because I really need a computer) they just say send it back and Amazon will refund you once they receive it...Wow! In my opinion the email seemed so rude and disconcerning of me as a customer...so I'm sending back will go to best buy to buy a laptop in person...WILL NEVER ORDER FROM THIS COMPANY AGAIN...MAKE YOU OWN DECISON...GOOD LUCK,!!!

Reviews.Title: Waste of money.
Reviews.Author: Mark Kuhn
Reviews.Content: This is the worst computer I have ever used. It's slow, it lags, it has crashed several times and I hardly have any documents or anything on it. Windows 8 is confusing and hard to navigate. Not to mention how difficult it is to find things on this pc. One of my biggest issues was buying office online. Every time I try to run the installation, it says it ran into an error and couldn't install. And I don't know why, but for some reason the internet is so painfully slow compared to other computers. Also the amount of popups I get while on any browser (even Firefox) is absurd. And yes I do have antivirus software, but it seems it hasn't done much. I've even had it "cleaned up", but still runs horribly slow. I would not recommend this laptop to anyone, especially a college student. Once I have the money, I'm switching over to a Macbook.
